results.title: Transition
results.creator_credit: Presbyterian Ladies' College, Rebecca Jordan and Sannah Maclean
results.brief_description: Reflecting on the past can sometimes help you make sense of the present. An elderly man contemplates his life alone when the family are gone.

results.title: La Mia Vita = My Life
results.brief_description: An elderly Italian man decides to look through his photo album. This causes him to reflect on his life. From his youth, to his adolescence, through to his older years, the man looks back on the moments of his life that he treasures the most, and those that are very dear to his heart.

results.title: Sky's Adventure [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Hurstbridge Primary School, Parker Arnel and Willow McFadzean
results.brief_description: ‘Sky’s Adventure’ is about a girl Sky and a mean girl Britney. Britney was never nice to anyone but she has to reflect on that when Sky says something to her. Will Britney change after reflecting on what she’s done or keep doing it?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hurstbridge Primary School, Parker Arnel and Willow McFadzean

results.title: The Devoted Friend
results.brief_description: This open ended Oscar Wilde tale challenges us to consider whether a bully is aware that they are a bully. It questions whether you can expect a bully to reform by asking them to reflect on their actions. The story shifts focus from the question “what is a bully?” to “what is a true friend?”.

results.title: Ignatius Quince: the cautionary tale of a Child Genius
results.brief_description: Every year the school held a science fair. Ignatius Quince, being the child genius he was, had won it for the last 5 years. This year was to be no exception. Ignatius Quince was going to build the most stupendous experiment. However plans don’t always run smoothly and Ignatius Quince gets a hand from a most unexpected person, Mable Syrup.

results.title: ACMI Presents: Legends of Australian Animation
results.brief_description:
To celebrate ‘DreamWorks Animation: The Exhibition’, ACMI decided it was a wonderful opportunity to invite five internationally-lauded Australian auteur animators to join us in a celebration of their careers, and to talk about the Australian animation industry.
Oscar winners and nominees Adam Elliot, Bruce Petty, Shaun Tan, Anthony Lucas and Sejong Park share their experiences, expertise and perspectives on their craft, their career histories and their production processes.
The panel was hosted by Melbourne cinematic stalwart Tait Brady.

results.title: From Jean-Paul Sartre to Teresa Teng: Cantonese Contemporary Art in the 1980s
results.creator_credit: Clair Hsu, Jane DeBevoise, Arts Asia Archive and Siren Films
results.brief_description:
Interviews with leading Cantonese artists and their memories of a developing art scene in the 1980s.

“The 1980s was a seminal period in the history of contemporary art in China. However, the contribution and experimentalism of the art scene in South China, in particular, Guangzhou and Shenzhen, have generally been overlooked. Due to the proximity of Hong Kong, western ideas from translated books and articles, as well as popular culture in the form of TV shows and Canto pop, flooded over the border to Guangdong at the end of the Cultural Revolution. This influx of new ideas and popular culture sparked great excitement, debate and experimentation in the arts.

Based on primary research, rare film footage and personal interviews with key artists, this documentary bears witness not only to the reading fever that gripped the Chinese art world in the 1980s, but also highlights the experimentalism and verve of artists and critics in South China whose contributions to the development of contemporary art have been long lasting and fundamental.” Source: Arts Asia Archive [www.aaa.org.hk]

Interviewees include: Chen Shaoxiong, Chen Tong, Deng Jianjin, Feng Yuan, Hou Hanru, Huang Xiaopeng, Li Zhengtian, Lin Yilin, Shao Hong, Wang Du, Wang Huangsheng, Xu Tan, Yang Jiechang and Yang Xiaoyan.
results.title_for_label: From Jean-Paul Sartre to Teresa Teng: Cantonese Contemporary Art in the 1980s

results.title: Rippled
results.creator_credit: Darcy Prendergast, All India Radio and Oh Yeah Wow Pty Ltd
results.brief_description:
‘Rippled’ features a range of animation techniques - including light painting - to evoke a dystopian nighttime urban landscape of eerie beauty being explored by a creature of ambiguous identity.
Animators: Josh Thomas, Michael Greaney, Josh OKeefe, Donna Yeatman, Darcy Prendergast, Seamus Spilsbury, Andrew Onorato
Music: Martin Kennedy (All India Radio)

results.title: In the air is Christopher Gray
results.brief_description:
A series of unfortunate events leads to disaster when young Christopher Gray tries to impress the girl of his dreams.
Written, directed and animated by Felix Massie.
Cast: Andy London, Peter Ahern, Justin Cassano, Carolyn London, Ian Miller, Erica Perez
Soundtrack: Joe Paine
Sound design and mix: Marty O’Brien

results.title: Subconscious Password
results.creator_credit: Chris Landreth, Marcy Page, Mark Smith, Copperheart Entertainment, National Film Board of Canada and Seneca College Animation Arts Centre
results.brief_description:
Most of us have had at least one of those excruciating social encounters where you can’t remember someone’s name. Just what is your subconscious up to while you frantically try to recall it?
Cast includes: Don McKellar, Ron Pardo, Patrice Goodman, Ray Landry, Tony Daniels, Athena Karkanis, Nanci Pach, Kedar, Denise Oliver, Dwayne Hill, Chris Landreth and John R. Dilworth.
Music: Daniel Janke
Animation direction and layout: Sean Craig
